details.description: For enquiries that are not about consular issues, email France.Enquiries@fco.gov.uk
details.access_and_opening_times:
Opening times

Monday to Friday, 9:30am to 1pm and 2:30pm to 5pm

Public holidays 2018

The British Embassy in Paris and the British Consulates will be closed on the following public holidays.

In an emergency, please call +33 (0)1 44 51 31 00

Date Holiday
Monday 1 January 2018 New Years Day
Friday 30 March 2018 Good Friday
Monday 2 April 2018 Easter Monday
Tuesday 1 May 2018 May Bank Holiday
Monday 7 May 2018 May Day
Tuesday 8 May 2018 8 Mai 1945
Thursday 10 May 2018 Jeudi de l’Ascension
Monday 21 May 2018 Lundi de Pentecôte
Monday 28 May 2018 May Bank Holiday
Wednesday 15 August 2018 Assomption
Monday 27 August 2018 August Bank Holiday
Thursday 1 November 2018 La Toussaint
Monday 24 December 2018 Christmas Eve
Tuesday 25 December 2018 Christmas Day
Wednesday 26 December 2018 Boxing Day

Getting to the embassy

Parking

Unfortunately there are no parking spaces available in the Faubourg. The nearest public car park is at Madeleine Tronchet and there is also a car park at Place de la Concorde (on the angle of avenue Gabriel) which provides a 24-hour service. Visit the Vinci website for more details.

Bus

For those of you who prefer to travel by bus, the following lines will get you close to the embassy: 24, 42, 52, 72, 73, 84, 94 or consult the RATP website in order to plan a more personalised route.

Metro

The nearest metro stations are Madeleine (lines 8, 12, 14), Concorde (line 1), Miromesnil (lines 9, 13) and Champs-Elysees (lines 1, 13). Route maps and service information can be found on the RATP website.

Train

The nearest train station is Saint Lazare which is about a 10-minute walk from the embassy. Service information can be found on the Transilien website.

Disabled access

For disabled persons, wheelchair access and assistance is available on request in all our buildings.

details.access_and_opening_times:
The Consulate in Bordeaux provides consular help for British Nationals and has a Department for International Trade (DIT) team advising in the advanced engineering sectors including aerospace, specialising in:

  • help for British companies with their business interests in France
  • help for French companies wishing to source supplies in the UK
  • help for British investors with a project to set up business in the UK
  • and publishes specific opportunities

Click here to contact the DIT team in Bordeaux

Opening times

  • Monday through Friday, 9.00am to 12.30pm
  • Phone lines are open Monday to Friday, 9am to 12.30am and 1.30pm to 4.30pm.
  • Outside normal working hours, a consular Emergency Service is in operation and be contacted on +33 (0)5 57 22 21 10

Parking

There is street parking available only in the side streets close to the office.

Bus

To reach the office, take bus 2, 5 or 56 from the centre or 9 from the station (Bordeaux St Jean).

Train

Bordeaux St Jean is the main train station in Bordeaux, to reach the office from here take bus 9 to Barriere du Medoc stop.

Tram

Take Line C from Bordeaux St Jean station and then take the bus.

From the airport

Bordeaux-Merignac Airport is approximately 12km from the office. To get to the office from the airport take bus 1 from the airport to Bordeaux St Jean train station and then bus 9 to Barriere du Medoc stop.

Access

The office is equipped with ramps and a lift for mobility impaired customers.

Public holidays 2018

The British Embassy Paris and the British consulates will be closed on the following public holidays.

  • Monday 1 January 2018
  • Friday 30 March 2018
  • Monday 2 April 2018
  • Tuesday 1 May 2018
  • Monday 7 May 2018

  • Thursday 10 May 2018
  • Monday 21 May 2018
  • Wednesday 15 August 2018

details.access_and_opening_times:
Opening times

  • Monday, Wednesday, Friday, 9.30am to 12.30pm
  • Outside normal working hours, a consular Emergency Service is in operation and can be contacted on +33 (0)4 91 15 72 10

Parking

The closest car parks to the office are:

  • Marseille Arvieux, rue des Docks, 13002 Marseille
  • Les Terrasses du Port, quai du Lazeret, 13002 Marseille
  • Marseille Joliette, rue Mazenod, 13002 Marseille

All are underground car parks.

Metro

La Joliette metro station is the closest underground station to the office and is served by line 2. Take the ‘Centre commercial’ exit and walk across the square to the old Docks building (Les Docks du Sud) which is now a shopping centre. Once inside the shopping centre, look out for the glass doors on your right with the atrium numbers. We are in atrium 10.3 and located on the first floor. When you come out of the lift, we are on the right.

Train

Marseille Saint Charles station is the main train station in Marseille with national and regional services from Paris, Lyon and Nice. To reach the office from the station, take line 2 on the métro to La Joliette underground station.

Tram

La Joliette tram station is the closest stop to the office and is served by lines 2 and 3. The tram station is approximately 300m from the office.

From the airport

Marseille Provence airport is approximately 28km from the office. Bus services run regularly from the airport to Marseille Saint Charles train station and take approx 30mins.

Access

The office is accessible for those with a mobility impairment.

Public holidays

The British Embassy Paris and the British consulates will be closed on the following public holidays.

The Marseille Consulate will be closed exceptionally on Monday 13 August. In an emergency, please call +33 (0)4 91 15 72 10.

details.access_and_opening_times:
The Trade and Investment Office (Délégation Commerciale du Royaume-Uni à Lyon) is the new technologies office of DIT for the whole of France.

We assist British companies in new, emerging and innovative technologies, notably life sciences, healthcare, medical & scientific instruments, biotechnology, pharmaceuticals, ICT, communications, electronics, environment, water, chemicals and advanced materials; analyse their needs and best path to market and provide operational assistance to access the French market.

In addition the office identifies inward investment opportunities in the Rhône-Alpes region and passes them through to the Department for International Trade at the Embassy. We maintain good relationships with French companies present in the UK and the local government commercial agencies.

Please note that consular services for this region are being provided by staff at the British Consulate in Marseille.

Opening times

Visits are by appointment only, please call +33 (0)4 72 62 99 55 for a meeting.

Parking

Brotteaux car park immediately outside the offices.

Bus

C1 trolley bus.

Metro

Line B (Brotteaux).

Train

5-10 minute walk from the mainline station (Part-Dieu).

Disabled access

Wherever possible, we have made our buildings and services accessible. Sometimes, however, this is not possible due to security or other restrictions. In these situations, we will endeavour to provide access to a building in an alternative way to ensure equality of access for disabled people. To assist disabled visitors, we have set out below details of disabled access at the Department for International Trade Office in Lyon. We hope this information is helpful.

General physical access

  • access to the Department for international Trade (DIT) office in Lyon is accessible to wheelchair-users via a lift situated to the right of the LE LUGDUNUM (5 Place Jules Ferry) main entrance
  • an intercom is available to contact your host who will come and meet you and escort you to the office
  • lifts are accessible for wheelchair-users and are fitted with handrails
  • there is a disabled toilet available on the first floor of the building
  • there is public parking available opposite
  • floor coverings: the floors of the DIT Office are even and flat. The maintenance of the pavements and roads of the surrounding areas are the responsibility of the local council, but are generally flat and accessible
  • you will be accompanied at all times however should you need assistance please inform your host
  • Emergency/Evacuation: a member of staff will assist disabled visitors in case of an emergency/evacuation.

Access for visually-impaired visitors

  • signs are clear and recognisable and use internationally recognised signs where appropriate
  • guide dogs are welcome

Access for deaf/hard of hearing visitors

  • hearing loops are not installed.
  • Minicom and textphones are not installed.
  • sign language is not available at this time.
  • hearings dogs are welcome.

Contact Us

If you need to visit us or use our services and feel that these may be inaccessible to you, please contact the DIT office by phone or email. We will try to find an alternative way of providing access for you.

Public holidays

  • Friday 14 April 2017

  • Thursday 25 May 2017

details.access_and_opening_times:
The UKTI team in Bordeaux specialises in the Advanced Engineering sectors including Aerospace. UKTI provides:

  • help for British companies with their business interests in France
  • help for French companies wishing to source supplies in the UK
  • help for British investors with a project to set up business in the UK
  • and publishes specific opportunities

Opening times

  • Monday to Friday, 9am to 5pm
  • To enter the Embassy you must have a pre-arranged appointment and photographic ID

Parking

The nearest car park is at the Barrière du Médoc.

Bus

For those of you who prefer to travel by bus 5, 6, 9, or 56 to Barrière du Medoc.
